author: Timothy Linward
description:
The long overlooked five color commander General Tazri might be about to have her day in the sun, as Magic: the Gathering players bring her out of retirement in anticipation of the upcoming Avatar: The Last Airbender set. Tazri is a five color commander who cares about the niche Ally subtype, and since news broke that Avatar Aang and all his buddies would be Allies, Tazri has shot up from her historically stable price of 50 cents to a (relative) high of $2.50.

Continue reading As Allies return for MTG Avatar, overlooked Commander card spikes b
title: As Allies return for MTG Avatar, overlooked Commander card spikes by 400%

author: Mollie Russell
description:
Us nerds are a nostalgic bunch, and Nintendo knows it. We’ll chase after the first edition Pokémon cards we cherished in the nineties, and we gobble up every classic that returns to us remastered. We’re gleeful, sitting ducks for all things Pokémon – so why has this one obscure videogame escaped us? Why haven’t we seen a rerelease of Pokémon Trading Card Game 2?

Continue reading Why don't they re-release this obscure Pokémon TCG game nobody's heard of?
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Pokémon cards, Rare Pokémon cards, All Pokémon sets in order
title: Why don't they re-release this obscure Pokémon TCG game nobody's heard of?

author: Mollie Russell
description:
Goodman Games, a long-time publisher of Dungeons and Dragons supplements, is offering a major discount on 36 of its modules. A new Fanatical bundle is offering the digital books for $12.99 (£11.60), though you can pick up as few as four of the modules for a dollar.

Continue reading Grab 36 third-party DnD expansions for the price of a pizza
MORE FROM WARGAMER: DnD 2024 Player's Handbook review, DnD classes guide, DnD races guide
title: Grab 36 third-party DnD expansions for the price of a pizza

author: Timothy Linward
description:
Following product leaks on social media on Wednesday, Games Workshop has revealed two new model kits for Warhammer 40k, the maniacal Chaos Space Marine Raptors, and the Adepta Sororitas anti-psyker specialists, the Celestian Insidiants. Both units will first be available in an upcoming Warhammer 40k Kill Team box set, called Shadowhunt, though its release is apparently far, far away.

Continue reading Warhammer 40k reveals new battle sisters and bat loving psychopaths
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Warhammer 40k starter sets, Best Warhammer 40k games, All Warhammer 40k factions
title: Warhammer 40k reveals new battle sisters and bat loving psychopaths

author: Timothy Linward
description:
Reader, I have been humbled. When Ken Burnside, a regular in the Wargamer Discord community, invited me to try out his miniature wargame Squadron Strike in an online demo, I thought I was prepared. “Space ship dogfighting with full 3D movement? Sounds like X-Wing with more steps!” I chuckled to myself. I was not ready. Squadron Strike is to Star Wars X-Wing what a quantum computer is to a Speak and Spell.

Continue reading Squadron Strike is Star Wars X-Wing's beefy big brother
MORE FROM WARGAMER: The best miniature wargames, The best Star Wars board games, Star Wars Legion roadmap
title: Squadron Strike is Star Wars X-Wing's beefy big brother

author: Mollie Russell
description:
Sometimes, a board game becomes famous for its scarcity as much as its quality. Camp Grizzly is one of those ghost stories, an out-of-print game that can only be found haunting second-hand markets at scarily high prices. All that changed on August 12, though. A new Kickstarter, crowdfunding a second printing, means that Camp Grizzly is back from the dead.

Continue reading My $300 holy grail board game finally gets reprinted after a decade
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best board games, Best board games for adults, 12 best horror board games for Halloween
title: My $300 holy grail board game finally gets reprinted after a decade
